data.title: Fixed stream disposing in Texture2D.Reload on WP8
data.body: Reload is an async operation on WP8 (if it'd be a blocking one, we would end up with a deadlock due to the threading on the platform). The caller doesn't know when we finished working with the stream, therefore we need to dispose the texture stream inside MonoGame.

data.title: MonoGame 3.2: Texture2D.GetData OpenGL IndexOutOfRangeException
SpriteBatch optimalizálás
data.body: Tesztelésre

data.title: Merge pull request #2 from mono/develop
data.body: Merge latest dev changes

data.title: Loading cubemaps from multi-face DDS maps
data.body: MGCB is not supporting that feature. It loads these files as single-face files. I try to implement this with FreeImage multipage bitmap (as seen here http://sourceforge.net/p/freeimage/discussion/36110/thread/40294256/) but I havent any luck. Perhaps use of NVidia DS library should be right way.

data.title: MediaPlayer.PlatformGetGameHasControl (iOS 6.0+ API with fallback to 3.0+ API)
Remove DateTime.Now
data.body:
This PR fixes the `DateTime.Now` garbage generation in the TouchPanel that @Nezz found in #2948.

I also went ahead and purged all uses of `DateTime.Now` in the runtime code replacing it with `DateTime.UtcNow`.  Not only is `DateTime.UtcNow` garbage free, but it is [several orders of magnitude faster](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/kirillosenkov/archive/2012/01/10/datetime-utcnow-is-generally-preferable-to-datetime-now.aspx).

data.title: Implemented Cue.Apply3D()
data.body: This PR implements the `Cue.Apply3D()` path in XAct.  This basically makes 3D audio work under XAct assuming `SoundEffectInstance.Apply3D()` is implemented on the target platform.

data.title: Added missing IsDisposed properties to SoundBank and WaveBank.
NullReferenceException on Game.EndDraw()
data.body:
![enddrawex](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3037711/4032907/425f4136-2c75-11e4-93c5-6e57bf939d63.jpg)

 this.GraphicsDevice.PlatformDeleteRenderTarget(this);
GraphicsDevice is null.

Thanks for your work!

data.title: Mipmap generation for mgcb
data.body: Add basic support for mipmap generation and also removes color bug in texture resizing.

data.title: Fixed TouchLocation DateTime garbage
data.body: TouchLocation generated a significant amount of garbage with DateTime.Now calls, even if the TimeStamp was unused. This was resolved by not calling DateTime.Now in the constructor without TimeStamp.

data.title: MGCB Mp3 to Platform Specific Audio File Conversion Error
data.body:
To whom it may concern,

I have started working with the MonoGame Pipeline tool, to create a MGCB file for building my game content.  When attempting to compress Music, the SongProcessor has an unexpected Failure, with a System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException (0xC00D4A44), which runs back to NAudio.MediaFoundation.IMFSinkWriter.DoFinalize().  Came across this error searching on Google, that falls back to the NAudio library that is being used by MGCB to build Audio Content.

The error is basically: MF_E_SINK_NO_SAMPLES_PROCESSED,  There is a Solution on the NAudio site, to add in a bool check for finishing of the writing, before actually Finalizing the IMFSinkWriter.  Ticket can be viewed here: http://naudio.codeplex.com/workitem/16439

It only happens on some of my songs, not all of them.

data.title: Fixed #2075
data.body: Cleaned up the usage of playingInternal to be WP only (#2075).

data.title: Reworked SignedInGamer for full iOS 4-8 compatibility
data.body:
The `SignedInGamer` class was recently updated to remove the old deprecated Game Center methods for authentication, leaderboards, and achievements. That's a great thing for iOS 6+, but in the process we unfortunately lost support for iOS 4.2 through iOS 5.1.

Since we had code that works perfectly for iOS 4.2-5.1 (and my game still supports iOS 5), I figure why not just support both the old way and the new way? This PR adds a version check and calls the right code depending on iOS version so that we use the new methods where possible, or fallback to the old if need be.

**Note:** The diff shows way more additions/deletions than I actually made, since the file was autoformatted to conform to the MonoGame coding guidelines. Most of the changes are just whitespace differences.

data.title: GameComponents added during Initialize() never have Initialize() or LoadContent() called

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
This one's a little bit tricky.

InitializeExistingComponents() is called during Game.Initialize, which takes a copy of all of the currently registered components and calls Initialize on them. If ComponentA is initialized like this and within that Initialize() call creates and adds ComponentB, ComponentB will never have the chance to initialize itself. The timing is a bit specific, as pretty much any GameComponents added during Game.Initialize() won't have the proper chance to initialize itself.

During InitializeExistingComponents(), we need to be checking the collection for changes and calling Initialize() on any new components added during this step.

data.title: More XAct Improvements
data.body:
This PR has a bunch more XAct runtime improvements:
- We now obey pitch for non-complex sounds.
- We gracefully handle missing wavebanks like XNA does.
- We now do proper weighted randomizations.
- Added volume and pitch variation play event support.
- We now read the sound priority.
- We now read panning randomization.
- We now read standard flags for simple playback events.

Still more to do, but this gets us much more compatible with XAct features.

data.title: iOS SpriteFont Draw performance
data.body: We have noticed that rendering text is really slow on iOS. Rendering ~20 lines of text brings the FPS under 10.

data.title: iOS 8 landscape rendering bug fix
data.body:
This PR fixes an [iOS 8 rendering bug](http://community.monogame.net/t/monogame-ios-8/997) that causes landscape games to be incorrectly centered and cropped.

**Note:** It looks like there are a ton of changes here, but it's mostly just whitespace changes (the file was autoformatted to match MonoGame coding standards). There are really just two small changes:
1. I fixed the way the `RectangleF` is created in `LoadView()` to support both iOS 7 (and older) and the new iOS 8 way of reporting resolution.
2. I swapped out the verbose license for the new concise license.

data.title: XAudio AudioBuffer looping bug
Handle audio interruption on iOS
data.body:
Based on solution posted in https://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/352487
Updated to use AVAudioSession as AudioSession is now deprecated.
Also updates MediaPlayer.GameHasControl to use AVAudioSession as this covers all other apps playing audio.

data.title: Not all desktops support anisotropic
data.body: Mesa3D does not support anisotropic filtering, so check for the extension before trying to use it.

data.title: Split TextureCollection into partial classes
data.body: for different graphics APIs.

data.title: Fixed GetData with row pitch when used with different element sizes
data.body: I originally fixed GetData to work with bytes, then @tomspilman changed it to work with Color, so now it's the time to make it work with different element sizes. I haven't tested it with extreme cases, like reading the 4 byte Color into a 3 byte struct.

data.title: Clear output window when a project is closed.
Matching original xna behavior.
data.body:
This fixes custom processors which were working with textures and assuming that:
1. Texture2DContent.Faces[0][0] would not generate a null reference for a newly allocated and uninitialized Texture2DContent.
2. texture2DContent.Mipmaps.Add(..) would not generate a null reference for a newly allocated and uninitialized Texture2DContent.

data.title: 'Debug Mode' Improvement
data.body:
When MGCB is launched with the "LaunchDebugger" flag, exceptions thrown within the importer/processor will not be caught/re-thrown.

This means that the debugger you attach to mgcb with when prompted by a Pipeline Tool 'Debug Mode' build will properly break at the location of the actual error within the importer.import and processor.process call(s).

data.title: Added WindowsGL target to platform target in Content Pipeline project
data.body:
Added the WindowsGL target to keep up to date with changes from https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2918

Fixes a build error when selecting WindowsGL thrown by ContentWriter.cs in the WriteHeader method.

data.title: MonoGameAndroidGameView.OnKeyDown/OnKeyUp returns true only if the event was handled.
data.body: This allows to handle unhandled events in [Activity.OnKeyDown()](http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Activity.html#onKeyDown%28int,%20android.view.KeyEvent%29)/`OnKeyUp()`.
